III. INVESTIGATION
1

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4109 Program Statement
Section (1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
Description statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’ needs,
implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation There was a fire at Gerber House on 12/31/23. A youth started the
fire in an empty bedroom of the house with a lighter he brought
back from a visit. This happened while all the youth were watching
a movie. There is video, no youth were injured.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on January 2,
2024. Complainant said there was not a known lack of
supervision, and the staff followed the emergency procedures.
Complainant said the youth involved in the incident have provided
written statements.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on
January 3, 2023. Youth A reported he has been placed at the
Gerber house for “almost one year”. Youth A stated Staff 1 and
Staff 2 were working with the youth on December 31, 2023. Youth
A then stated, “I’m not replaying that day”, and got up and left the
room. Since January 3, 2024, Youth A has been advised by his
Lawyer Guardian Ad Litem not to speak to anyone about the fire
incident.
Youth B was interviewed via TEAMS on January 9, 2024. Youth
B said a few days prior to the fire, Youth A showed him a lighter he
had brought back from a home visit with his grandpa. Youth B said
Youth A told him to go down to his room and he stood in Youth A’s
doorway and Youth A was lighting the lighter in front of him but did
not light anything on fire that day. Youth B said he never told staff
that Youth A had a lighter. Youth B said the night of the incident
Youth A said he was going to start the fire and Youth D put a hat
on to “get ready”. Youth B said neither Staff 1 nor Staff 2 were
aware of what Youth A was planning. Youth B said Youth A started
the fire and none of the other youth told Staff 1 or Staff 2 about it.
Youth B said Staff 2 heard the beep from the fire alarm and Staff 1
saw light from an empty room and when she went to check it, she
saw the fire and made all the youth leave the house. Youth B said
staff had them get in the car and go to another house and on the
ride to the other house Youth A told him that he threw the lighter in
the fire once it was lit. Youth B said staff were supervising the
youth the night of the fire and had no knowledge of Youth A’s plan.
2

Youth C refused to be interviewed via TEAMS on January 9,
2024. A second attempt to interview Youth C was completed face-
to-face at the facility, on January 17, 2024, and Youth C refused to
be interviewed.
Youth D was interviewed via TEAMS on January 9, 2024. Youth
D was very hesitant to speak to me and was only willing to answer
a few questions. Youth D said he was aware that Youth A had a
lighter and never told staff. Youth D said the staff were supervising
all the youth that evening both in the hallway and in the living
area. Youth D said none of the staff knew what Youth A was
planning to do that night.
Youth E was interviewed via TEAMS on January 9, 2024. Youth
E said he has been at Gerber house for about two months. Youth
E said he was at the house when it started on fire on December
31, 2023. Youth E said he had no information that Youth A was
going to start the fire. Youth E said he does not remember “much”
from that night but stated staff were supervising all the youth
throughout the incident and he does not remember them being left
alone at any time.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on January
3, 2024. Staff 1 said she was working on December 31, 2023.
Staff 1 said she put a movie on for the youth in order to prepare
and pass night medications. Staff 1 said Youth A, Youth B, Youth
C, and Youth D kept getting up and going up and down the
hallway. Staff 1 said youth are allowed to be in the hallway and in
their rooms however in this situation they were not asking
permission to cross into that area so she redirected them to stay
in the living room. Staff 1 said she noticed the light in the empty
room was on but did not think much of it at the time. Staff 1 said
Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D started to whisper and
laugh among themselves, so she asked them what they were
talking about, and they said it was a “joke” and Staff 1 said she
told them to stop whispering to each other. Staff 1 said Youth A
had a small blue drawstring bag he was carrying around and she
asked him what was in it, and he showed her a remote car and
shampoo. Staff 1 said Youth A said he was waiting to take a
shower which was why he had some of his hygiene products. Staff
1 said she was in the staff office getting a youth’s medication
ready and Staff 2 said he could hear an alarm going off. Staff 1
came out of the staff office into the living room and Staff 2 went
downstairs to check the alarm as that is where it sounded like it
was coming from. Staff 1 said Staff 2 came back upstairs and said
3

it was not downstairs but rather the hallway. Staff 1 said she went
down the hallway and noticed the smoke from the empty bedroom
door. She opened the door, and the entire bunkbed was on fire.
Staff 1 said she and Staff 2 took all the youth outside and to the
basketball court and she called on-call supervisor while Staff 2
called 911. Staff 1 said she did not have any concerns about the
supervision of the youth, noting she or Staff 2 were watching the
youth throughout the night. Staff 1 said she and Staff 2 followed
the emergency procedure and none of the youth were injured.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility, on January
3, 2024. Staff 2 said after dinner Staff 1 put on a movie for the
youth to watch as she was preparing and passing medications in
the staff office, and he was supervising the youth in the living
room. Staff 2 said Youth A went down the hallway and into his
room a few times throughout the movie however never stayed
down the hallway for more than a few minutes at a time. Staff 2
said the movie ended and Youth A, Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
all went down the hallway with Youth A entering his bedroom and
the other youth standing in the hallway. Staff 2 said he was
supervising the hallway area and told Youth A, Youth B, Youth C,
and Youth D to come back into the living room which they did, and
he turned on a television show for them to watch. Staff 2 said he
heard a soft “beep” and thought it was coming from the basement
so asked Staff 1 to come into the living room while he went
downstairs to check the noise. Staff 2 said once in the basement
he realized it was not coming from there but sounded more like
the upstairs hallway. Staff 2 said he returned upstairs and told
Staff 1 and she went down the hallway and opened a bedroom
door and smoke came out of the room. Staff 2 said he and Staff 1
took all the youth outside to the basketball court and he called 911
while Staff 1 called the on-call supervisor. Staff 2 said he did not
have any concerns about the events leading up to the fire and
stated he had been supervising the youth as they were in the
living room and the hallway and did not notice any concerning
behaviors.
Supervisor was interviewed via TEAMS on January 9, 2024.
Supervisor said he is the supervisor for the Gerber House.
Supervisor said Youth A had been on a home visit for Christmas,
returning on December 27, 2023. Supervisor said he conducted
the search of Youth A upon his return. Supervisor said he
searched Youth A’s person, two bags, and a shoe box and did not
find anything of concern. Supervisor said neither he nor any of the
staff were aware that Youth A had a lighter in his possession.
4

Video Review:
Video footage of December 31, 2023, Gerber House was
reviewed on January 17, 2024. The video footage was viewed
for the timeframe of 7:04pm until 7:41pm. The youth are seen in
the living area as well as in the hallway and going in and out of
their bedrooms. Staff 1 was supervising the youth, going in and
out of the staff office, and passing medications. Staff 2 was seen
supervising in the living area, hallways, and positioning himself in
a manner where he was able to see both the living area and
hallways when the youth moved between the two. The video
footage shows staff appropriately supervising the youth per the
Eagle Village “Supervision of Residents” procedure.
Documents Reviewed:
• Eagle Village Supervision of Residents Procedure was
reviewed on January 8, 2024. The procedure outlines that
staff should be aware of youth’s whereabouts at all times,
however, does not require line of sight at all times. If two or
more youth are in the hallway it requires staff to position
themselves to see the hallway for proper supervision. If a
youth goes into the hallway alone to go into their bedroom
staff do not need to maintain sight of the hallway but rather
are required to do complete room checks at irregular
intervals not to exceed fifteen minutes.
• Eagle Village Search Procedure was reviewed on January
8, 2024. The procedure states “Staff should ensure youth
and/or their belongings are searched when they return to
the house after being out of staff supervision”.
• Eagle Village Safety Procedures was reviewed on January
9, 2024. The procedure outlines the expectations of staff in
the case of a fire. The expectation is for staff to evacuate all
youth from the house when they hear a fire alarm, staff to
return to determine if there is a real fire if necessary and
call 911 for assistance.
• Youth A written statement dated January 1, 2024, stating “I
am the one who burnt down the house. It was peer
pressure. Another youth, [Youth B], came back from his
home pass, he gave me a lighter last Thursday. [Youth D],
[Youth B], and [Youth C] were peer pressuring me. They
said if I didn’t do it, they were going to jump me.”
• Youth B written statement dated January 1, 2024, stating
“[Youth A] was the person who lit the house on fire. He had
got it from his grandpa and put it in a ball of yarn.”
• Youth C written statement dated January 1, 2024, stating
“[Youth A] lit the place on fire and he planned it with his
lighter at home.”
5

• Youth D written statement dated January 1, 2024, stating
“its [Youth A]”.
• Youth E written statement dated January 1, 2024, stating
“My name is [Youth E] and I only know some stuff. So
basically [Youth A] told me last week that he was going to
light the house on fire and that was the last I heard about
that.”
• Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 1 completed the required Safety Training on June 14,
2022, and Supervision Training on May 23, 2023.
• Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record.
Staff 2 completed the required Safety Training on
November 15, 2023, and Supervision Training on
November 9, 2023.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with Program Statement. The
staff completed the appropriate search upon Youth A’s return from
his home visit and there is no evidence that the staff were not
supervising the youth the night of the fire.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.

sir_summary.summary: A youth at Eagle Village Gerber-Putnam facility started a fire in an empty bedroom on December 31, 2023, using a lighter brought back from a home visit, while other youth were present and staff were supervising. The investigation concluded that staff followed procedures, conducted proper searches, maintained appropriate supervision, and responded appropriately to the emergency. The report determined that staff were not aware of the youth's plan to start the fire and did not violate supervision policies. Ultimately, the facility was found in compliance with all applicable licensing rules, with the primary culpability falling on the youth who intentionally started the fire.
